content: simple gaiter a lovely little neck warmer to be a simple alternative to scarves or cowls materials needed worsted weight yarn h hook yarn needle as always i start each row with the no-turning-chain-double_crochet video tutorial available at youtube if you do not know how to do this technique or simply prefer not to you may start with a ch3 instead also if you don t like doing magic_ring you can ch3 or ch4 and slip_stitch to form a ring the gaiter is worked in back-and-forth row turn after each row until after the edging and then is worked in the round stop turning work row 1 3dc ch1 3dc in magic_ring row 2 2dc in first st double_crochet in next 2 sts shell 2dc ch2 2dc in chain space double_crochet in next 2 sts 2dc in last st row 3 2dc in first st double_crochet in next 5 sts to the last double_crochet before the chain space shell in chain space double_crochet in next 5 st to the next to last st s 2dc in last st row 4 2dc in first st double_crochet in next 8 sts to the last double_crochet before the chain space shell in chain space double_crochet in next 8 sts to the next to last st 2dc in last st row 5 2dc in first st double_crochet in next 11 sts to the last double_crochet before the chain space shell in chain space double_crochet in next 11 sts to the next to last st 2dc in last st continue on in this manner adding 3dc to each side until the top edge of the triangle just fits around the largest part of your head edging ch1 single_crochet in same st * ch2 2dc in same st as single_crochet skip 1 st single_crochet in next st * repeat from * to * until you read the chain space at the center spine single_crochet should hit last double_crochet before center spine chs 6dc in chain 2 space single_crochet in first double_crochet after center spine repeat from * to * single_crochet in last st collar single_crochet in same st as end of edging to turn the corner rotate and work 2sc into every double_crochet on the top edge of the triangle incl 1sc into the starting magic_ring when you reach the end of the top edge of the triangle bring the tips of the top edge of the triangle together do not use a slip_stitch to join instead single_crochet into the first top edge single_crochet and continue on and single_crochet in the spiral unjoined rounds to the desired height a height of 2-3 should be sufficient but if you want a taller collar so you can fold it over for extra thickness that is totally fine slip_stitch at the back of the collar to finish off weave in ends block if desired designer s note this pattern can be adapted for any
